articles.description: Dr Rachael Grimaldi was inspired by hearing of a Covid-19 patient's terror while in intensive care.
articles.content:
Image copyrightPA MediaImage caption
 Dr Rachael Grimaldi said she had been on maternity leave but was "desperate to help"
A doctor on maternity leave has created a series of digital flashcards to help NHS workers better communicate with patients while wear… [+1505 chars]

articles.author: Jo Farrow
articles.title: The ups and downs of Air Pollution in a time of COVID19 - Blog by Jo Farrow - Netweather
articles.description: Headlines stating that air pollution is down seem like a glimmer of good news in the never-ending COVID19 news outpourings, but this is not the whole story. NO2 levels are lower, PM and O3 are not.
articles.content: Weds 8th April - Fri 10th April, London and south-east England experienced widespread air pollution with a large number of monitoring sites breaching the threshold for 'Moderate' particulates.  This episode was driven by air recirculating at low altitudes ove… [+9547 chars]

articles.author: Svar Nanan-Sen
articles.title: UK told to brace for year of restrictions in 'BEST case' as lockdown grinds down Britons - Express
articles.description: THE coronavirus lockdown will need to continue in some form for at least a year in order to suppress transmission of COVID-19 according to Mathematical Biology professor Neil Ferguson.

articles.author: Moya Lothian-McLean
articles.title: Black woman in US dies after being turned away from hospital she worked at for 31 years - indy100
articles.content:
A black woman who died of Covid-19 complications was apparently refused a test four times by the hospital shed worked at for 31 years, her daughter claims. 
Deborah Gatewood, a phlebotomist who worked at Beaumont Hospital in Farmington Hills, Detroit, died o… [+3320 chars]

articles.author: Ryan Smith
articles.title: Ten more coronavirus cases in Hartlepool as another patient treated at town's health trust dies - Hartlepool Mail
articles.description: Two more people have died after testing positive for coronavirus at Hartlepool’s NHS hospital trust as the number of cases in the town rose to 165.
articles.content:
The statistics show 69 people have died in hospitals covered by North Tees and Hartlepool NHS Foundation Trust as of today, Monday, April 27.
In total, 938 people who had tested positive for coronavirus have died across the North Easts hospital trusts, an in… [+3063 chars]
